meanings.sent1: I found a sou in my pocket.
meanings.sent2: She only had a sou left to buy a snack.
meanings.sent3: He joked that a sou was all he had left after shopping.
meanings.sent4: The sou in his hand felt like a treasure.
meanings.sent5: The sou gleamed in the sunlight, precious to him.

meanings.definition: A former French coin of low value
meanings.sent1: The antique shop displayed an old sou.
meanings.sent2: In history class, they talked about the French sou.
meanings.sent3: She pretended to pay with a sou at the pretend store.
meanings.sent4: The sou was a relic of a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The sou bore the mark of French heritage.

meanings.sent2: He ordered sou noodles at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: She slurped the sou noodles with gusto.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of sou noodles filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The sou noodles were a comforting meal.

meanings.definition: The central or most important part of something
meanings.sent1: The sou of the matter was finally revealed.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the sou of the problem was crucial.
meanings.sent3: She pondered the sou of the story for hours.
meanings.sent4: The sou of the painting captured everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The sou of the plan was the key to success.
